posts.content:
vwgillybilly wrote:
Magic8Ball wrote:Yep, no what you mean, take this for example ..........

viewtopic.php?f=51&t=105781

Complete with deluxe trim, and 4 bolt wheels in Carlos Fandango Arches ..........OK it is a RHD Devon but no pics of anything at all. This looks like a RHD that somehow ended up in the states and has now been bought back to Europe ? Can't see why anyone would want a RHD to look like something from the US ? Probably just me but i don't get it

It's ok now ......just had to vent that


Jero bought my old SO 23 Westy. Now there's a story.

Unorthodox sale to say the least.


I bet ...........

Turned up with 10k in Euros & expected to drive it back & pay the remainder of the £25k balance upon his return to Germany!

That's a long story very short!

Gill

True story (I made it up myself)

When we bought my wifes Late bay Westy we drove from London to Pembrokeshire to see it, wanted it straight away and naively proceeded to do a online bank transfer which the bank wouldn't authorise as it was just over £10K and I had never paid her before.. and it was Saturday afternoon after 5:00 and the nearest branch (Swansea I think) was closed till Monday. Kids had to be back to school Monday.. The seller who was a vicar said she was prepared to take a leap of faith with me.. signed the V5, gave me a receipt and let me take the Westy home and pay her on Monday!!! Which I did..

I would have never have put that kind of trust in anyone.. kind of sad really.. cool story to go with our van thou

I'd trust you...Faith in the decision of the agents of the Lord...
Even with my (yours?) easicool!

LOL

I wouldn't trust me.. I damaged something I borrowed off another member on here (well the body shop did not me personally but it was under my trust) still feel bad about that, the guy ignores me now too

btw those seals arrived, got the day of tomorrow to play with them will report back (don't worry I won't let anyone else touch them lol)
